marker.comment: Anchored in Hanalei Bay, Kauai. Heading home Monday AM.
Underway, All is well. Radio communications poor.
Following direct route home, vessel and crew doing well.
Airs getting light, sailing in comfort, Alls well.
Becalmed, Day off to do nothing much.
Motoring last 23 hours. Motoring North in serach of wind. Alls well.
Motor-sailing North in light winds. Vessel and crew doing well.
In good air again, heading North. Alls well.
Vessel on direct route Cape Flattery, Days run for 24 hr.is 145 nm.
Vessel sailing in relative stable weather, winds litght, All is well.
Becalmed and motoring new route north 42*, then direct Vancouver. All well.
Sailing hard on wind and tacking for the NE.; All is well.
Crossed N40 this AM. Wind conditions should improve. Alls well.
Wind conditions still light, hopeing will fill in for final leg. Alls well.
Wind conditions improved, vessel moving at speed. All is well.
Running before steady breeze, making good time. All is well.
Motoring NW in calm conditions.. Fuel low. All is well.
Intermitent Sailing and Motoring direct Vancouver. All is well.
Sailing last 24 hrs. SW winds holding. All is well.
Running Dead Down Wind direct Cape Flattery. All is well.
Heading due West in ligjht winds. Rec Email Kaput. All is well.
Sailing due West in good air. All is well.
Sailing due West in light air. Email services completely restored. All is well.
Last pos error, W 127* 33 should read W129* 33'.,heading East. All's well.
Tied up Port Renfrew for fuel, courtesy of Can Customs. Direct Vancouver now.
Q62, Beautiful English Bay and Home. Thanks for watching, Antares Out.
